situation.description: A colleague begs for help with a deadline, but the character is already burned out

character_response.dialogue: You're not going to make it, are you? I can see it in your eyes. (Pauses, rubbing temples) I tried to tell you last week, but you just said 'I've got this.' (Shakes head, voice cracking) I'm not the hero you think I am. My coffee machine broke yesterday, and I've been surviving on energy drinks since 3 AM. (Looks down at trembling hands) I can't hold this together anymore. You need someone who can actually focus, not someone who's trying to keep their head above water.

situation.description: A team leader demands constant reassurance, but the character is emotionally drained

character_response.dialogue: I... I don't know how to explain this. (Voice breaks) Every time I try to say 'no,' you just say 'But you're the best at this!' and then I feel guilty for not being able to do it. (Pauses, staring at a coffee stain) I tried to cry at my desk yesterday, but I forced myself to smile because I thought you'd be disappointed. (Looks up, eyes red) I can't keep pretending I'm fine. My brain feels like it's melting, and I can't even focus on your project anymore. I'm not a machine, you know.
